title: Object Pronouns (me, you, him, her, it, us, them)
description: Learn object pronouns to replace nouns that receive the action in sentences

core_concept.summary: Object pronouns replace nouns that receive the action. Use them after verbs and prepositions.
key_points: I → me, you → you, he → him, she → her, it → it
Use after verbs: I see him, She likes me
Use after prepositions: with me, for her, to them

rules.description: Object pronouns replace the object of a sentence (who/what receives the action)
examples: I see Alex → I see him
Alex helps Sophie → Alex helps her
We call the teacher → We call her
The dog follows the children → The dog follows them
They invited us to the party.

rules.description: Use object pronouns after prepositions (with, for, to, at, etc.)
Complete list: I→me, you→you, he→him, she→her, it→it, we→us, they→them
examples: Subject: I, You, He, She, It, We, They
Object: me, you, him, her, it, us, them
I see you → You see me
We know them → They know us

common_mistakes.explanation: Use object pronoun 'him' after the verb, not subject pronoun 'he'
Use object pronoun 'me' after prepositions, not subject pronoun 'I'
Use object pronoun 'us' after the verb, not subject pronoun 'we'
Use object pronoun 'them' after prepositions, not subject pronoun 'they'
Use subject pronoun 'I' at the beginning of sentences, not object pronoun 'me'
